cs_words_capitalize.title: Capitalized words
cs_words_capitalize.desc: List any words you want capitalized a specific way. One word per line.

styleguide.desc: These words should always be capitalized as follows:

cs_contractions.title: Contractions
cs_contractions.desc: Contractions are words like: aren't, what's, they're. Friendly, conversational content tends to use contractions.

desc.suggest: Use common contractions like what's and aren't instead of what is and are not.
desc.avoid: Don't use contractions. E.g. Write: what is and are not.

cs_serialcomma.title: Serial comma
cs_serialcomma.desc: A serial comma is a comma placed after the second last item in a list of three or more items, before 'and' or 'or'.

desc.suggest: Use serial commas. Add a comma after the second last item in a list, e.g. A, B, and C.
desc.avoid: Don't use serial commas. Don't add a comma after the second last item in a list, e.g. A, B and C.

test.TODO: INCORRECT: nowhere, Dorsey and Twitter went silent. AND world, meaning women and people of color.

cs_sentencelength.title: Sentence length
cs_sentencelength.desc: Warn me when sentences are over the specified word count.

cs_variedstructure.title: Content breaks
cs_variedstructure.desc: Break content up by using visual elements like headings, images, lists, or blockquotes regularly to help people scan.

desc.0.1: Break content up using a heading, image, list, or blockquote at least once per 10 paragraphs.
desc.0.2: Break content up using a heading, image, or blockquote at least once per 5 paragraphs.
desc.0.25: Break content up using a heading, image, or blockquote at least once per 4 paragraphs.
desc.0.33: Break content up using a heading, impact, or blockquote at lease once per 3 paragraphs.
desc.0.5: Break content up using a heading, image, or blockquote at least once per 2 paragraphs.

test.feedback: Not enough content breaks - add more headings, images, blockquotes, or lists.

cs_end_of_sentence.title: End of sentences
cs_end_of_sentence.desc: Warn when people use specified characters at end of sentences.

feedback.curly: Use curly character in $match

desc.curly: Use curly quotation marks and apostrophes. E.g. “ and ’
desc.emdash: Use long em-dash for parenthetical asides. E.g. I was doing this – and that – last week.
desc.ellipses: Use the correct ellipses character of … rather than ...

cs_uncomparables.title: Absolute terms
cs_uncomparables.desc: Avoid using modifiers with absolute terms. E.g. very unique, more inevitable.

cs_offensive.title: Offensive words
cs_offensive.desc: Avoid common swears and other offensive words.

cs_archaic.title: Old-fashioned words
cs_archaic.desc: Avoid old fashioned words. E.g. spake, whosoever, enclosed herewith, forthwith.

cs_idioms.title: Idioms and clichés
cs_idioms.desc: Avoid common idioms and clichés. E.g. can of worms, whole nine yards.

cs_passive.title: Active voice
cs_passive.desc: Warn when people write in passive voice. E.g. The letter was mailed by Marilyn.

styleguide.desc: Active voice is when the subject is doing the action. E.g. 'Marilyn mailed the letter' instead of 'The letter was mailed by Marilyn'. Passive writing is often longer and harder to understand than active writing.

cs_doublenegatives.title: Double negatives
cs_doublenegatives.desc: Avoid double negatives. E.g. that won’t do you no good.

cs_adverbs.title: Adverbs
cs_adverbs.desc: Warn when adverbs are used as they tend to be weak words. E.g. quickly, definitely, extremely.

styleguide.desc: Avoid adverbs. They can make sentences weak and wordy.

test.internalnote: Only detect 5-char or more -ly words (with specific 4 letter ones) to avoid July, Lily and other false positives.

cs_splitinfinitives.title: Split Infinitives
cs_splitinfinitives.desc: Detect split infinitives. E.g. to quickly finish, to really pull.

styleguide.desc: Avoid split infinitives. E.g. to quickly finish.

test.internalnote: Only detect 5-char or more -ly words (with specific 4 letter ones) to avoid July, Lily and other false positives.

cs_misused.title: Misused words
cs_misused.desc: Detect commonly misused words. E.g. supposively, tow the line.

cs_weakwords.title: Weak words
cs_weakwords.desc: Avoid weak all-purpose words, that can lead to wordiness. E.g. somewhat, perhaps, therefore.

wordlist.weak: (a bit|a little|a lot|anything|anytime|anyway|considerable|deal with|deals with|have got|I believe|I feel|I think|is then|kind of|maybe|ok|okay|one of|particular|perhaps|quite|rather|seem|seemed|seems|somehow|somewhat|sort of|stuff|therefore|thing|things|used to|various)

(a bit|a little|a lot|about|actual|advantage|adventure|almost|already|also|amount|anything|anytime|anyway|appears|area|aspect|attitude|attractive|back|background|bad|beautiful|beauty|been|began|begin|being|beneficial|benefit|big|bizarre|broad|but|case|certain|character|clear|close to|cold|community|considerable|consideration|could|creative|critical|deal with|deals with|definite|degree|difference|disadvantage|down|earliest|even|every|factor|feel|felt|given|good|have got|here|hot|however|I believe|I feel|I think|important|individual|instead|is then|it was|just|kind of|like|little|maybe|might|most|much|never|nice|now|often|ok|okay|one of|only|out|particular|perhaps|pretty|quite|rather|real|right|scary|seem|seemed|seems|situation|small|some|somehow|something|somewhat|soon|sort of|specific|start|started|stayed|stuff|such|therefore|thing|things|think|to be|to the|too|try|type|up|used to|various|walk|was [a-z]+ing|way|well|went|whatever|whenever|wherever|whoever|would)

cs_negativewords.title: Negative words
cs_negativewords.desc: Avoid negative words. E.g. angry, fear, mistake.

styleguide.desc: Avoid URLs in content. For links, use the name of the website or a description of the linked page instead of linking the plain URL.

cs_statistics.title: Statistics
cs_statistics.desc: Show content statistics. E.g. reading level and number of words.

cs_setting_ignoretags.title: Ignore specified tags
cs_setting_ignoretags.desc: Don't perform style guide checks in selected types of tag.

cs_setting_checkdelay.title: Delay before checks
cs_setting_checkdelay.desc: The delay between when a person stops typing and the style guide checks and gives them feedback.

cs_setting_gutenberg_disable.title: Disable Gutenberg
cs_setting_gutenberg_disable.desc: Disable WordPress Gutenberg editor on post types that use the Editist Style Guide plugin.
